result.execSummary:
The defendant John Kevin Walton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Kevin Walton in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant John Kevin Walton in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT #1 & COUNT #2:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (0) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, mental health and Alcohol Drug treatment. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the mental health unit, with the following conditions:
*Mental Health Evaluation and comply with all treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Stay on all prescribed medications. 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*No Contact with Edgar C. and Marquessa Y. 
*No Violent Contact with anyone.
*Defendant is to provdie DNA specimen and  pay mandatory DNA surcharge by 6-1-2015.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be ordred filed against the defendant. 
*Court ordered all other costs and surcharges WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation.  
AS TO COUNT #2:  Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of (0) days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, mental health and Alcohol Drug treatment. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the mental health unit, with the following conditions:
*Mental Health Evaluation and comply with all treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Stay on all prescribed medications. 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*No Contact with Edgar C. and Marquessa Y. 
*No Violent Contact with anyone.
*Defendant is to provdie DNA specimen and  pay mandatory DNA surcharge by 6-1-2015.  If not paid, a civil judgment will be ordred filed against the defendant. 
*Court ordered all other costs and surcharges WAIVED due to defendant's financial situation.  
AS TO COUNT #3:  On motion of the state, Court ordered Ct. #3 DISMISSED, but to be read in for the purpose of senencing.  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk jks
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant John Kevin Walton not in court, in custody, Not produced.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. These are new cases for the defendant.  Cases are previously set in Branch 46.  Defense request these be set on the same day for plea and sentencing. jks
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant John Kevin Walton in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John Kevin Walton in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46 due to lower pending case 14CM3934.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
